Articles.Content:
Hello! Today I am ready to provide you with the Russian workhorse R-7.My trouble is that all of your addons I start exclusively for RSS, but his hands are not as not finish it begun before the end =). At this stage, on past the first two stages of the launch represented "fairing Soyuz 2.1 "" fairing Soyuz Y "" Block I "," Block E "," fairing to block E "EAST" "steering Engine Block A" "steering Engine Block I".

License: Model Rocket belongs to its creators, without their permission, it can not be used for personal purposes

REQUIRED ADDONS

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55985

Without this great plugin steering motors will not work, because it's sad :*(

USEFUL ADDONS

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/...nt-v2-1-3-7-14

With this plugin we do not need struts ;-)

P.S Please let me know about errors, if you find them.

I hope that you will enjoy!!!

DOWNLOAD

(Removed until permission is secured)

Edited August 26, 2014 by NathanKell
link removed until permission obtained
Nice work! The parts are very well made.
Looks very nice. Downloading for testing now.

Looks like people finally started getting the verniers right. It looks pretty good. Does the Blok E also have both of it's verniers functional? Those two things sticking out of it are also steering engines. The old Blok I (the one with RD-0110, not the newer RD-0124 one) also had verniers.

Also, it seems you've got the entire family covered. You could model the latest Blok I with RD-0124, and some more fairings, but that's about it. There's plenty of upper stages you could also model. There's Fregat, Ikar and Blok L. If you need data on them, I can find you some.
These look pretty awesome just to check I've read it correctly this is real life size to work with RSS? Can this be resized by us to work with Bobcat's Soyuz?
Sadly I have had to remove the link to this excellent addon due to lack of permission to use the models; let's hope Desolator can secure permission to use the models soon and can put it back!
What was the name of the file? I'm trying to find out if I downloaded it before the link was removed.

What was the name of the file? I'm trying to find out if I downloaded it before the link was removed.

It was R 7 hope it helps.

It was R 7 hope it helps.

Cheers mate, turns out I still had it. I basically download every mod I see to my other hard drive, I think the OP's username used to be Desolator.

It did. The OP requested a change.

Speaking of which: DECQ (nÃƒÂ©e Desolator) and raidernick are now working together, so I'm closing this thread. Stay tuned for more Soviet/Russian awesomeness!
